channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: XMem: Long-Term Video Object Segmentation with an Atkinson-Shiffrin Memory Model
item.description: We present XMem, a video object segmentation architecture for long videos with unified feature memory stores inspired by the Atkinson-Shiffrin memory model.

item.title: Towards Grand Unification of Object Tracking
item.description: We present a unified method, termed Unicorn, that can simultaneously solve four tracking problems (SOT, MOT, VOS, MOTS) with a single network using the same model parameters.

item.title: YOLOv7: Trainable bag-of-freebies sets new state-of-the-art for real-time object detectors
item.description: YOLOv7 surpasses all known object detectors in both speed and accuracy in the range from 5 FPS to 160 FPS and has the highest accuracy 56. 8% AP among all known real-time object detectors with 30 FPS or higher on GPU V100.

item.title: Ivy: Templated Deep Learning for Inter-Framework Portability
item.description: We introduce Ivy, a templated Deep Learning (DL) framework which abstracts existing DL frameworks.

item.title: Tracking Objects as Pixel-wise Distributions
item.description: During inference, a pixel-wise association procedure is proposed to recover object connections through frames based on the pixel-wise prediction.

item.title: Adversarial Pixel Restoration as a Pretext Task for Transferable Perturbations
item.description: Transferable adversarial attacks optimize adversaries from a pretrained surrogate model and known label space to fool the unknown black-box models.

item.title: Language Modelling with Pixels
item.description: Language models are defined over a finite set of inputs, which creates a vocabulary bottleneck when we attempt to scale the number of supported languages.

item.title: CogVideo: Large-scale Pretraining for Text-to-Video Generation via Transformers
item.description: Large-scale pretrained transformers have created milestones in text (GPT-3) and text-to-image (DALL-E and CogView) generation.

item.title: HiFormer: Hierarchical Multi-scale Representations Using Transformers for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose HiFormer, a novel method that efficiently bridges a CNN and a transformer for medical image segmentation.

item.title: Open High-Resolution Satellite Imagery: The WorldStrat Dataset -- With Application to Super-Resolution
item.description: We hereby hope to foster broad-spectrum applications of ML to satellite imagery, and possibly develop from free public low-resolution Sentinel2 imagery the same power of analysis allowed by costly private high-resolution imagery.

item.title: TokenMix: Rethinking Image Mixing for Data Augmentation in Vision Transformers
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel data augmentation technique TokenMix to improve the performance of vision transformers.

item.title: Out-of-Distribution Detection with Deep Nearest Neighbors
item.description: In this paper, we explore the efficacy of non-parametric nearest-neighbor distance for OOD detection, which has been largely overlooked in the literature.

item.title: ObjectBox: From Centers to Boxes for Anchor-Free Object Detection
item.description: We present ObjectBox, a novel single-stage anchor-free and highly generalizable object detection approach.

item.title: Structure PLP-SLAM: Efficient Sparse Mapping and Localization using Point, Line and Plane for Monocular, RGB-D and Stereo Cameras
item.description: This paper demonstrates a visual SLAM system that utilizes point and line cloud for robust camera localization, simultaneously, with an embedded piece-wise planar reconstruction (PPR) module which in all provides a structural map.

item.title: MetaFed: Federated Learning among Federations with Cyclic Knowledge Distillation for Personalized Healthcare
item.description: Federated learning has attracted increasing attention to building models without accessing the raw user data, especially in healthcare.

item.title: Masked Autoencoders that Listen
item.description: Following the Transformer encoder-decoder design in MAE, our Audio-MAE first encodes audio spectrogram patches with a high masking ratio, feeding only the non-masked tokens through encoder layers.

item.title: Gender Classification and Bias Mitigation in Facial Images
item.description: We worked to increase classification accuracy and mitigate algorithmic biases on our baseline model trained on the augmented benchmark database.

item.title: Fast ABC-Boost: A Unified Framework for Selecting the Base Class in Multi-Class Classification
item.description: Our framework has parameters $(s, g, w)$.

item.title: Registration based Few-Shot Anomaly Detection
item.description: Inspired by how humans detect anomalies, i. e., comparing an image in question to normal images, we here leverage registration, an image alignment task that is inherently generalizable across categories, as the proxy task, to train a category-agnostic anomaly detection model.

item.title: You Should Look at All Objects
item.description: Feature pyramid network (FPN) is one of the key components for object detectors.
